Topic.Title: What's at stake in Doha climate talks

Message.Msg: Carbon taxes are a very stupid and regressive way to deal with the problem of pollution. The tax is either passed into the price of products which disproportionately impacts low income consumers, or is avoided entirely by industry relocating its energy intensive production to places like China. The best way to deal with the problem is a Speculator Tax, that is, a very high tax rate on capital gains and dividends to fund government sponsored energy research, and secondary and higher education in the sciences. The best model would be something close to what was in place before the election of Ronald Reagan: a 39.875% tax on long term capital gains, and a 70% tax on ordinary (short term capital gains and dividend) income over $1,000,000.

Message.Title: GOP throwing in the towel.
Message.Msg: Just the other day Steve Forbes praised Clinton's economic policies, encouraging Obama to stand firm his campaign to reduce the deficit by abolishing Bush Tax Cuts. Forbes does elaborate, and says he wants spending cuts along with the tax increases. Of course that is what Obama has been saying since the summer before last - a balanced approach of tax increases and targeted spending cuts to ferret out waste. Alas, it will not be sufficient to raise taxes back to the Clinton levels, though. Over $10 trillion in new debt has been accumulated thanks to the Bush Tax Cuts and the riot of speculation and economic distortion they caused. So taxes will have to be raised higher on the speculators to service the $10 trillion in new debt...

Message.Title: Offshore Banking Reform
Message.Msg: Simple: all banks, broker-dealers, bank holding companies, insurance companies, investment banks, or other financial institutions which have FDIC insurance, or which fall under the regulatory power of the Federal Government or Federal Reserve, should be prohibited from doing business overseas in areas outside the regulatory power of the U.S. government. Any business that refuses to cease and desist from such activities should be held criminally liable and its officers subject to prosecution for fraud. So would end the riot of speculation in such worthless activities as betting or insuring foreign government debt or setting up offshore subsidiaries to speculate in oil and other commodities.
